Name: Las Barracas  Tempranillo - Cabernet Sauvignon Gran Reserva
Les Hautes Terres Rosé
Notes: Minor sediments, semi-cloudy clarity. White-brown. Rotten fruit aromas, perhaps peach, apple. Light on palate. Dry.

Name: Bordeaux Blanc Sec
Notes: Clear, gas evidence. Mild nose. Lemon. Heavy on the palate. Soft. Medium acid. Medium alcohol.

Name: Vecciano Toscana
Notes: Dark, cloudy, happy berry notes. Medium- tannin. Off-dry. Medium+ body and acid. Ruby rim. Purple core.

Name: Macari Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc
Notes: Cloudy, off white, minor gas evidence, distinctive honey lemon notes, some mineral, spice notes. Very smooth palate. Nice fruity notes

Name: Grüner Veltliner
Notes: Distinctively dry, peach, pear, medium medium plus body. Clear color. Some bittersweet notes.

Name: Gewürztraminer
Notes: Lychee, honey right out front. The nose already feels dry or off dry. Surprisingly sweeter after taste than expected. Really balanced lengthy finish.

Name: HJW Vineyard Riesling
Notes: Very very bright sweetness, fruit. A Riesling on the drier side. The nose is exactly what I drank. No more surprises. A smoother sparkly finish that the Wolffer Chard. Mineral.

Name: Perle Chardonnay
Notes: Really creamy and rich on the palate. Some hard acidity in there. Mellow oaky notes. Some sparkly after taste not sure why. Left something of a coffee burn. Didn’t have the burn or sparkle on the second try.

Name: Special Blend
Notes: Long lasting intense fruity aromas. Nice jam flavors. Low tannins. Deep purple core. No sediment. Medium plus acidity.

Name: Primitivo Puglia
Notes: Clear. Dark violet color. Fruity and instant oak nose. Low tannins, medium alcohol, spicy notes. Medium minus acidity. Medium body. Prominent blackberry, dark cherry

Name: Chianti Riserva
Notes: Ruby garnet. Rim tending towards brown. Mild oak earthy cherry notes. Medium plus acidity. Fairly sour finish. No tannins.

Name: Pinot Grigio
Notes: Pear, apple notes. High sour notes. Fairly smooth finish. Lemon aftertaste. Light bodied.

Name: Brut Nature Vintage
Notes: Nice dry notes.

Name: Bourgogne Chardonnay
Notes: Mellow buttery notes. Smooth on the palate. Medium minus alcohol. Mildly acid profile. Citrus. Minerals.  Basic complexity.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc
Notes: Bright lemon, pear, apple notes. Medium plus acidity. Dry. Definite citrus. Medium length finish.

Name: Vineyard Select Cabernet Sauvignon
Notes: Deep purple core. Mildly brown rim. No visual evidence of tannins. Dominant oak, dark berry, hints of vanilla, fruity tobacco sorts. Medium tannins, very smooth and balanced finish. Medium acidity, medium alcohol.

Name: Florés Sancerre
Notes: cloudy on first look. Pale golden brown. Very balanced pear, lemon notes. Medium (plus?) alcohol. Very balanced citrus notes. Very dry.

Name: Les Angelots Pouilly-Fumé
Notes: Bright golden color. Brighter lemon, green kind of notes. Feels fresh. Definite pear, peach. Medium plus body, high on the acidity and sourness. Minerals. Balanced sour finish.

Name: K Riesling
Notes: Interestingly dusty nose. Feels dry right on first nose. Very dry palate. Minerals dominate sort of.

Name: Bremmer Calmont Riesling
Notes: Clear off dry nose. More than the Oregon Paetra. sweet notes on the palate. Fairly long and bright finish. Minerals dominate, mildly citrus.

Name: Morstein Riesling GG
Notes: Butterscotch, caramel, chocolate right off the nose. Golden brown color (under mellow lights of the bar). Minerals, stone. Well balance sweetness. Very low acidity. Smooth butter finish. The flavor is like the Battello Chardonnay (no bottles just in house by the tap) multiplied over and over and smoothly balanced.

Name: Domaine de Buadelle Minervois
Notes: Dark purple core, heavy legs. Dark berry nose. Mild oak. Minerals. Earthen content in the nose. No evidence of sediment. Heavy on the palate. Smooth tannins, mineral-y finish. Medium plus to full body.  Blackberry. Fairly dry.

Name: Próximo Rioja
Notes: Medium garnet color. Heavy oak, chocolate. cherry mixed with mellow leather tones. Medium to high acidity, smooth leathery finish. Low tannins

Name: Villa Blanche Chardonnay
Notes: Mellow minerals. Pineapple, honey flavors on the palate. The finish is dominated by the honey tones. Medium alcohol, medium balanced acidity. But nothing exciting about it. Pale straw color.

Name: Le Viognier
Notes: Interesting dominated pepper nose. high acidity, sourness. Residual flavors. Medium plus body. Cloudy core. Just like I’ve seen with previous Viogniers.

Name: Samorëns Côtes-du-Rhône Rouge
Notes: Bright golden color. Lemon, peach, pear flavors on the nose. High acidity, medium plus to high alcohol.

Name: Chardonnay
Notes: Refreshing honey, melon flavors. Smooth buttery finish. Medium plus alcohol and acidity.

Name: Merlot
Notes: Dark ruby tending towards purple. Heavy legs, appears to be full bodied. Heavy oak, chocolate, blueberry, blackberry nose. Soft tannins, feels relatively young on the palate. Not very fruit forward though and low complexity and finish.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon
Notes: Heavy legs, fruitier than the previous Merlot. The nose feels fruity cherry, the nose is relatively smooth. The oak is less pronounced and blends very well with the blackberry nose. The tannins are stronger yet velvety. High alcohol and acidity.

Name: Macari Vineyard Merlot
Notes: Very fruit forward, blackberry, cherry, blueberry. Blend with oak. Medium bodied. Leaves vanilla essence of sorts towards the end. Dry finish with a velvety smooth palate.

Name: Pinot Noir
Notes: Very fruit forward nose. Bright cherry and raspberry prominent. Brighter than ruby color I guess. Low on tannins. Feels juicy on the palate. Very light. Mild acidity.

Name: Les Pierblancs Sancerre
Notes: Distinctive pale color. The color does complete justice to the nose. Evokes fresh juicy fruit emotions, perhaps melon, watermelon juice. Fairly light legs. Very light on the palate, soft mineral finish. One of the best rosé I’ve had so far!

Name: Le Merlot du Donjon
Notes: Very deep color and heavy legs. Quite an obvious plum dominant nose as expected from a Merlot. Definitely feels full bodied. Some secondary spice flavors. Mild oak of sorts. Smooth velvet palate. Tannins on the lower side. Medium plus alcohol. The velvet finish gives a sense of balance.

Name: La Lande Cavagnac Cahors Malbec
Notes: This is a really good Malbec! Well balanced spice nose. Heavy legs. Can clearly feel the boldness while pouring. The spice nose feels dry yet very soothing. The blackberry nose is gently softened by the oak aging. Medium tannins, again velvety touch. Feels a lot like wine dominated by black cherries. The oak gives a leather finish.

Name: Château Suau Blanc Sec AOC Bordeaux
Privada Malbec
Notes: Deep purple core. Off the bat oak flavored. Blackberry. Seems well balanced, slightly off dry notes. Smooth velvety palate. Medium tannins, medium bodied. The acidity is well balanced by the tannin flavors.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc
Notes: Instant citrus, lemon nose. Really fresh palate. Some bubbly elements. But evokes very fresh flavors. The sourness peaks on the tongue quite instantly

Name: Rioja Gran Reserva
Notes: Very nice blueberry blackberry flavors. Fairly heavy legs. Feels like a medium bodied. The berries are well balanced with oak, and hints of vanilla. I can feel the acidity in my nose. Anticipating a very good palate. Heavy tannins, slightly harsher on the palate. I paired this with chicken broth, tempranillo cooked prawn and the wine spices were well complemented. The aromas really fulfill the sinus in a weird way.
